results.title: Escape to Witch Mountain
results.creator_credit: John Hough, Jerome Courtland and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Two orphans develop telekinetic powers and escape from exploitative adults with the aid of a grieving widow. They retreat to Witch Mountain, discovering their powers, which include predicting the future, levitating objects and mastery over animals. This extremely popular family oriented children’s film features Eddie Albert, Ray Milland, and Donald Pleasence, with Kim Richards and Ike Eisenmann, playing the imperilled children.

results.title: Escape from Jupiter
results.creator_credit: Fumitaka Tajima, Kate Woods, Terry Jennings and Film Australia
results.brief_description: When a volcanic eruption destroys the mining colony on Jupiter’s moon Io, Michael, Kumiko, Gereard, Kingston, Anna and a small group of surviving adults are forced to flee their crumbling world. They convert the derelict space station KL5 into a makeshift spacecraft and head off in a desperate attempt to reach Earth. Their hazardous journey takes them past the spectacular rings of Saturn and through a massive asteroid belt. As they approach the safety of Earth one last and unpredicatable disaster awaits them. There is only one chance for survival… Based on the Film Australia/NHK Co-production.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fumitaka Tajima, Kate Woods, Terry Jennings and Film Australia

results.title: Escalier C = Staircase C
results.brief_description:
Lafont, a rarefied, egocentric, malicious art critic, and ruthless womanizer, is jolted by a series of encounters and experiences into reconsidering his character. The film’s title refers to the floor of the apartment block where Lafont lives and periodically crosses paths with his neighbours, including a gay artist whose affection he does nothing to discourage. What begins as an intriguing character study degenerates into a superficial and soft-centered film, largely dominated by stereotypes, and of no particular distinguishing features. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producer, Marie-Dominique Girodet ; director, Jean-Charles Tacchella ; writers, Elvire Murail, Jean-Charles Tacchella ; photography, Jacques Assuerus ; music, Raymond Alessandrini.
Cast: Robin Renucci, Jean-Pierre Bacri, Jacques Bonaffe, Catherine Leprince, Michel Aumont.

results.title: Erte
results.brief_description: Art Deco is perhaps the most important design movement of the Twentieth Century, and Romain de Tirtoff, better known as Erte, is the artist who contributed so much to its development and acceptance as a legitimate art form

results.title: Entree des Artistes = the Curtain Rises
results.brief_description:
Entree des Artistes’ details the lives and loves of several students at the Paris Conservatory of Drama. Wealthy student Cecilia is in love with fellow student Francois and jealous of his relationship with poor student Isabelle. Cecilia successfully plots to break-up the relationship. As the end of the presentation approaches, Cecilia decides to play the part of a woman who dies of poisoning. Of particular interest in this film is the ‘real-life’ scene in which Louis Jouvet plays his own role as a teacher at the Paris Drama School rehearsing young actor Bernard Blier.

Credits: Producer, Georges Jouanne ; director, Marc Allegret ; writers, Henri Jeanson, Andre Cayatte ; photography, Christian Matras, Robert Juillard ; music, Georges Auric ; art direction, Jacques Krauss, Alexandre Trauner.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Janine Darcey, Claude Dauphin, Odette Joyeux, Andre Brunot, Mady Made, Julien Carette, Marcel Dalio, Sylvie, Roger Blin, Bernard Blier, Michel Vitold.

results.title: Errigal
results.creator_credit: Patrick Carey, Vivien Carey and Aengus Films
results.brief_description: Errigal is the highest peak of the Decryveagh Mountains in Donegal, Ireland. The mountains and weather impose their own moods on the landscape and the film conveys this feeling of personality in a landscape through the striking use of visuals, music and natural sound

results.title: Enterprising women
results.creator_credit: Hubert Schuurman, Lulu Keating, Barry Cowling, Shelagh Mackenzie and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: By focusing on six female entrepreneurs, Enterprising Women captures the essence of what it means to own your own business: the pitfalls and the joys. Women are relatively new to the area of business ownership, but they’ve already demonstrated a high success rate in a variety of fields. The women profiled here run companies dealing in pasta, lumber, fish, silk-screening, and a business academy. Each one expresses her personal and business philosophies.

results.title: Ernani: opera in four acts
results.creator_credit: Preben Montell, Luca Ronconi, National Video Corporation and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Giuseppe Verdi’s opera in four acts with libretto by Francesco Maria Piave produced for television and performed at Teatro Alla Scala, Milan in 1982. “Ernani” (based on Victor Hugo’s play Hernani) is Verdi’s fifth opera and perhaps one of his most successful pieces of work. First presented on March 9, 1844, Verdi’s “Ernani” went on to become his most performed work for the next fifteen years. It is a passionate story of unrequited love, rivalry, honour, ambition, and revenge leading ultimately to a tragic conclusion. Set in 16th century Spain and Aachen the stage sets for the first three acts are sombre and atmospheric in hues of blues, greys and silver contrasted by the fourth act of warm colours of sunset, gold and bronze. This is quite a spectacular production featuring four world leading Verdi singers in the major roles - Placido Domingo as the bandit Ernani, Mirella Freni as the heroine Donna Elvira, Renato Bruson as the scheming and very suave Don Carlo, King Charles of Spain and Nicolai Ghiaurov as the proud older Don Ruy Gomez de Silva, Donna Elvira’s intended betrothed. The four singers are superb in the way their voices compliment each other and they are supported by an equally class performance from the Orchestra and Chorus of La Scala, with Romano Gandolfi as Chorus Master and Riccardo Muti as Conductor. Sung in Italian with no subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Preben Montell, Luca Ronconi, National Video Corporation and Radiotelevisione Italiana
